Hi Naveen,

The entity which you selected for Content Aware Policy which you are enforcing was "user" but the DPI setting which you toggled ON and OFF when testing the policy was on the computer level.  The below rights functionality is set on "Computer", considering this there are mismatches as to how the policy will be enforced.

You had the DPI setting turned on on user level but this was not effective as the right functionality is currently set to "Computer", so the settings on the computer level took priority while the CAP policy was set on "User"

[cid:image008.png@01DB2F84.57100DA0]

Considering the above, can I kindly ask you to only test on computer level please? So switch the DPI and Stealthy DPI driver on under "Device Control" > "Computers" > "Manage Settings".

Leave this setting turned on, on the computer level.  Make sure to select your computer under the CAP policy.  Update the policies on the EPP client, and then open the EPP client and make sure that the DPI shows "Enabled"

After this, please enable the URL category again and re-test the scenario.  Uploads made to Virustotal and the domains listed in the URL category should be blocked while uploads to any other domain not listed in the URL catogary should not be blocked.

Could you please test it after making the changes advised above and let me know if EPP works as expected?

If you would like to look at this together in a a remote session then we can do so but I am out of office tomorrow and will be back next week Monday.  Could you test this in the meanwhile and see if it works as expected please?


Kind regards

Hi Naveen,

I remember in our previous remote session that your "Endpoint Protector Rights Functionality" was set to "Use both" and "Computer Rights".  For DPI, it will remain off even when the DPI is turned "ON" on the User level and "OFF" on the Computer level.  See below screenshot.

DPI is reported to be "OFF" in the EPP client under the "Troubleshooting" tab, when the "Endpoint Protector Rights Functionality" is set to "Use both" and "Computer Rights".  This means the last test that we did towards the end of our call today, the DPI was in fact "OFF" and the CAP policy was enforced on all domains not just the URL category.  Now if you set the functionality rights to "User Rights" and update the policies then you will notice that the "DPI" will be enabled on the EPP client.

Here the DPI is turned on on the user level but off on computer level the same as you had the setting earlier for your machine.
[cid:image008.png@01DB2F84.57100DA0]

I just wanted to form you of the above.  In the meanwhile I will wait for the artifact, review the logs and test the scenario further as discussed earlier on our call and then get back to you with more details.
